page.title: 06ROUND HOUSE
page.content: The Round House stands alone in the countryside ,so tucked away that most people do not know it is still standing, it is the last survivor of it's kind in the Midlands. It was built as the Incline Keeper's house on the Leicester Swannington Railway which was the second Railway built in the world. The slope of the Bagworth Incline was 1:29, running downhill to Thornton.The coal travelled downhill towards Leicester, so the weight of the coal in the wagons pulled the empty wagons up. The first train ran in 1832. The Round House was built in an ideal spot as the Keeper had fine views of the Railway line. Today it is the victim of constant vandalism.
